get kmer-counts for character vector of sequences

Source: R/RcppExports.R
get_kmers.Rd

get kmer-counts for character vector of sequences

get_kmers(seqs, n = 2L, both_strands = FALSE)

Arguments

seqs

character vector of sequences
n

kmer size
both_strands

if TRUE, each kmer and it's reverse complement will be counted as the same kmer. The kmer reported will be the kmer first in lexicographic ordering. Set this if analyzing strand non-specific sequences i.e. some DNA motifs, or unstranded sequencing reads. Default = FALSE

Examples

get_kmers(c("ATCGATGCTGATCGT",
            "ATGCTAGCTAGCTGATATATATCGATGTAGCTG"),
            4)
#> [[1]]
#>    kmer counts
#> 1  ATCG      2
#> 2  ATGC      1
#> 3  CGAT      1
#> 4  CTGA      1
#> 5  GATC      1
#> 6  GATG      1
#> 7  GCTG      1
#> 8  TCGA      1
#> 9  TCGT      1
#> 10 TGAT      1
#> 11 TGCT      1
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>    kmer counts
#> 1  AGCT      3
#> 2  ATAT      3
#> 3  ATCG      1
#> 4  ATGC      1
#> 5  ATGT      1
#> 6  CGAT      1
#> 7  CTAG      2
#> 8  CTGA      1
#> 9  GATA      1
#> 10 GATG      1
#> 11 GCTA      2
#> 12 GCTG      2
#> 13 GTAG      1
#> 14 TAGC      3
#> 15 TATA      2
#> 16 TATC      1
#> 17 TCGA      1
#> 18 TGAT      1
#> 19 TGCT      1
#> 20 TGTA      1
#> 

get_kmers(c("TTTTAAAA"),
         n = 4)
#> [[1]]
#>   kmer counts
#> 1 AAAA      1
#> 2 TAAA      1
#> 3 TTAA      1
#> 4 TTTA      1
#> 5 TTTT      1
#> 

get_kmers(c("TTTTAAAA"),
          n = 4,
          both_strands = TRUE)
#> [[1]]
#>   kmer counts
#> 1 AAAA      2
#> 2 TAAA      2
#> 3 TTAA      1
#>
